Chris Carter

Solitude

by Chris Carter

You move beyond my eyes 
And speak words beyond my ears
I cannot conceive Your thoughts
Nor can I understand Your ways. 


I sense You like a thick fog
You envelop me at every place and time
And move my heart either to rejoice 
Or to break. 


Why does solitude wash me with unbearable despair?
Who is closer to me than You?
How indescribably horrible am I
That Your presence isn’t enough for me?
